labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is focused on providing weather forecast services, specifically offering real-time meteorological data through simple APIs. The available tool, 'get_live_temp', allows users to retrieve live temperature data based on geographic coordinates. This indicates the server's core functionality is centered around weather data retrieval and integration, which is crucial for applications requiring real-time weather information.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Weather" is chosen because the server's main purpose is to provide weather data. The secondary label "API Integration" is appropriate as the server is designed to provide data through standardized protocols for application integration. "Data Analysis & Processing" could also be a secondary label, as analyzing weather data is part of what the server offers, though it is less central than weather-related functions.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.name: Weather Forecast Service
server_info_crawled.author: @alperenkocyigit/weather-forecast-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide accurate and up-to-date weather forecasts to enhance your applications with real-time meteorological data. Enable seamless integration of weather information through a standardized protocol for improved decision-making and user experience. Simplify access to weather data with easy-to-use tools and resources.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@alperenkocyigit/weather-forecast-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
